A: Iterative development with continuous customer feedback
B: Linear progression through phases with no backtracking

Question: What is a functional requirement in a software system?
A: A description of system performance under load
B: A limitation on system response time
C: A description of an action the system must perform
D: A requirement related to information security

Question: What is the primary purpose of Code Review in the software development process?
C: To identify defects and improve code quality

B: Separation between logic, user interface, and data
D: Elimination of the need for testing

A: It becomes more stable over time
D: It requires fewer resources to maintain

Question: Which of the following best describes the difference between evolution and servicing in a software system?
A: Evolution adds new functionality, while servicing only fixes bugs
B: Servicing adds new features, while evolution freezes functionality
C: Evolution stops once the system is deployed, servicing begins afterward
D: Servicing replaces the system, while evolution maintains it

Question: Why is legacy system replacement considered risky?
A: Legacy systems cannot be integrated with modern hardware
B: Legacy systems always have low business value
C: Business rules are often undocumented and embedded in the system
D: Replacement systems never meet user requirements

Question: Which type of maintenance focuses on adapting software to a new operating environment?

A: Adding new features to a system
B: Rewriting the system using new technology
C: Improving code structure without changing functionality
D: Fixing runtime bugs discovered by users
